intro: Nautilocalyx resioides, commonly known as the slender nautilocalyx, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and small, clustered flowers with yellowish-white petals. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a leathery texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
